metrics.name: Basic Earnings Per Share (EPS)
metrics.definition: Measures the portion of a company's profit allocated to each outstanding share of common stock.
metrics.formula_text: (Net income − Preferred dividends) / Weighted average common shares outstanding
notes: Use weighted-average shares over the reporting period.

metrics.name: Diluted Earnings Per Share (EPS)
metrics.definition: EPS assuming all dilutive securities (options, convertibles, RSUs) are exercised/converted.
metrics.formula_text: (Net income − Preferred dividends) / Diluted weighted average shares outstanding
notes: Reflects potential share dilution; typically \leq basic EPS.

metrics.name: Price-to-Earnings (P/E) Ratio
metrics.definition: Valuation multiple showing how much investors pay for $1 of earnings.
notes: Use trailing 12-month EPS for trailing P/E; forecasts for forward P/E.
Not meaningful when EPS \leq 0; compare within the same industry.

metrics.name: Net Profit Margin
metrics.definition: Share of revenue remaining as profit after all expenses.
notes: Related: Gross margin = Gross profit / Revenue; Operating margin = Operating income / Revenue.

metrics.name: Return on Assets (ROA)
metrics.definition: Profit generated per dollar of assets; measures asset-use efficiency.
notes: Some analyses use EBIT / Average assets to remove capital-structure effects.

metrics.name: Debt-to-Equity Ratio (D/E)
metrics.definition: Leverage measure showing how much debt finances the company relative to shareholders’ equity.
notes: If equity is negative, D/E is not meaningful.

metrics.name: Basic Average Shares
metrics.definition: The weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the reporting period.
metrics.formula_text: Sum of daily outstanding shares weighted by time / Reporting period

metrics.name: Diluted Average Shares
metrics.definition: The weighted average number of shares outstanding, including dilutive securities like options and convertibles.
metrics.formula_text: Basic average shares + Potential dilutive shares
metrics.formula_latex: \(\text{Diluted average shares} = \text{Basic average shares} + \text{Potential dilutive shares}\)

metrics.name: Net Income Common Stockholders
metrics.definition: The profit allocated to common stockholders after expenses and preferred dividends.
fields_needed: Net income from continuing & discontinued operation

metrics.name: Total Revenue
metrics.definition: The total income generated by the company from its operations before any expenses are deducted.
